sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A heat engine operates between a hot reservoir at a temperature of 600 K and a cold reservoir at a temperature of 300 K. What is the Carnot efficiency of this heat engine?
message_2:
The Carnot efficiency is the maximum possible efficiency for a heat engine operating between two reservoirs at different temperatures. It is given by the formula:

Carnot efficiency = 1 - (T_cold / T_hot)

where T_cold is the temperature of the cold reservoir and T_hot is the temperature of the hot reservoir. In this case, T_cold = 300 K and T_hot = 600 K.

Carnot efficiency = 1 - (300 K / 600 K) = 1 - 0.5 = 0.5

The Carnot efficiency of this heat engine is 0.5 or 50%.
